summary: The Canadian Snowbirds Act of 2025 amends the Immigration and Nationality Act. It allows Canadian retirees, who meet specific criteria (age 50+, Canadian citizenship, residence in Canada, U.S. residence/rental agreement, and other conditions), to be admitted to the U.S. as visitors for pleasure for up to 240 days per year. It also addresses the tax status of these individuals under the Internal Revenue Code.
